intro: Liabum andromachioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf liabum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and pod fruits. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branching stems and small, trifoliate leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to greenish in color, and it produces elongated pods that contain several seeds. Liabum andromachioides is often found in grassy areas and along roadsides, adapting well to disturbed soils.
